title: hash/crc32: should document that tables returned by MakeTable should not be modified
body:
Was playing around manually modifying the Table in one package and was surprised to find out that it causes CRC32 errors in another package.

The name ```MakeTable``` seems to indicate that a unique table will be created and returned. But for the IEEE and Castagnoli polynomials specifically, it returns a reference to tables held globally. This has the following consequences:
 * Modifying a table returned by MakeTable(IEEE), may or may not cause all CRCs that use the IEEE polynomial to be incorrect. [This is because there are special cases where it uses a special iEEETable8 if the input table is a pointer match to IEEETable](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/1e0760354c8a929d9d84575106ae264fa6395132/src/hash/crc32/crc32.go#L155).

* Modifying a table returned by MakeTable(Castagnoli) may or may not cause other Castagnoli polynomials to be wrong. [This is because if the input table is a pointer match to castagnoliTable and the hardware support CRC instructions, it will use the built in instructions or table.](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/1e0760354c8a929d9d84575106ae264fa6395132/src/hash/crc32/crc32.go#L151) Either way, the behavior is very confusing.

* Modifying a table returned by MakeTable for any other polynomial works as expected.

See https://play.golang.org/p/IWehs0lQAc
